title: Jean Ducamps
summary: Jean Ducamps, Giovanni di Filippo del Campo or Giovanni del Campo (1600, Cambrai or Cambrai – 1648, Madrid), was a Flemish Baroque painter who spent most of his career in Italy where he enjoyed notoriety for his religious compositions, genre scenes and allegories.  He worked in a style that was influenced by Caravaggio and is counted amongst the Northern Caravaggisti.
